text: the HBS has provided a great place for
me to learn more about myself my values
my priorities
it provided a risk-free medium in which
I could learn how to have some of those
very important conversations which we
don't typically have in our personal or
professional life but should looking
into all of those different facets and
aspects I came to realize that I'm truly
driven I'm truly most motivated when I
am working on endeavors that seem to
empower and drive economic growth in
some aspect that relates to Africa so my
internship in Cape Town last summer I
spent eight weeks with an investment
management firm in Cape Town called Alan
gray they invest in equities and fixed
income across the African market and
they manage about fifty billion dollars
in assets under management it was an
amazing experience but with that
learning also came realization I wanted
to be a little more engaging with
businesses in terms of helping them
change helping them transform helping
them get to the next level
I think targeting the clubs which align
with the company's interest is
definitely a good place to start at HBS
students are typically interested in a
lot of different things but then joining
clubs is kind of a way of students
filtering what they're truly passionate
about one club that definitely had a
huge influence on my interest and my
experience at HBS was the Africa
Business Club and so beyond that I
became great friends to some of the
members of the club and it truly had an
influential role in my HBS experience
so I will be moving to Johannesburg I am
joining a private equity fund there the
company is called Tana Africa capital
and we would focus on investing across
the continent in consumer goods and
agribusinesses but if you truly want to
see change in those environments that
are less privileged today you have to
find individuals who are motivated to
change those environments not
necessarily those who have the most
resources to change the environment
you
